intro: Bunium pityranthon, commonly known as the mountain bugloss, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, which contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Bunium pityranthon is valued for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor soils.
